sentences.sContent: The details of his life remain obscure.
Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.sCn: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

synos.tran: 模糊的；晦涩的；[光]昏暗的

remMethod.val: ob(之上) + scur(覆盖) + e → 覆盖在上 → 掩盖

words.tran: 朦胧；阴暗；晦涩；身份低微；不分明

trans.tranCn: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
trans.tranOther: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly
